revised_title: Parent-Offspring Conflict and Begging Signals: Do Parents Always Win?
tldr: This article explores the concept of parent-offspring conflict and how begging signals can influence resource allocation between parents and their offspring. The author develops a model that considers the effects of parental feeding on subsequent offspring solicitation, showing that parents may allocate more resources than would be optimal to reduce the cost of future begging.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
